content.description: Stand start on decent underclings, climb up a nice rail to a desperate toss using small, smeary feet. Finish up a delicate slab.
content.location: On the Overhung section of the wall, it is the farthest right problem

content.description: Sit start on incut crimp rail, climb up and left before climbing right through an awesome sloper and an incut rail. Bad holds, good feet and powerful. Honestly felt lucky on the send of this boulder  so please weigh in on the grade if you try this one. Name courtesy of my father who told me I needed more dyno juice to send.
content.protection: Bring lots of pads, this boulder has a way of eating foam.
content.location: North facing side of the boulder, left of Beez Neez. This problems shares a sloping crimp and the jug start of Cherry squeeze.

content.description:
It goes straight up the rights side of the boulder, or you can begin the left crack and traverse low over to the crack system. 

 if you crack climb it is not hard, if you try to layback or pull through it could bump the difficulty!

 Down climbing is not a problem.

 Has probably been climbed before but thought I could
content.location: There is two cracks on the opposite side of the overhang. The right crack with broken blocks on the start is the route.

content.description: Start on a massive jug and squeeze your way up on slopers to a hard top out. You can either mantle straight over utilizing a crack feature or traverse right to the top out of Dino-Juice.
content.location: Farthest left problem on the overhung side

content.description: Pull on with underclings and suspect feet, utilize some trickery to climb straight up on some awesome holds. This problem does not let up until you are at the top. Great technical problem on excellent stone. It may be extremely spanny for some.
content.protection: Pads and maybe a knee bar pad. The landing slopes slightly
content.location: The line on the boulder. North facing side right in the center.

content.description: Quality granite boulder right off the road, there may be others lurking in the area! Awesome setting in the pines intermixed with plenty of brush. Besides the down climb, all the harder problems are north facing and see plenty of shade!! There is also some potential for unique more moderate crack type boulders. I've heard whispers of others climbing here and imagine plenty of folks have seen it. Let me know if you have any FA information or history and i'll get it in here!
